messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: "bad" words
messages.msgSnippet: ... Yup. It s your naughty bits. Which is why fanny-pack had me bemused for a while :-) Shyrley
messages.messageBody:
amycats2@... wrote:

> Hi!
> I've also heard that "fanny" is used in the UK a little differently than we
> do in the US. We use it to mean butt, bottom, rear-end, etc....but they use
> it to mean...ummm..."woman parts." Is that right, Shyrley?
> Amy
> Amy Kagey

Yup.
It's your naughty bits. Which is why 'fanny-pack' had me bemused for a while :-)

Shyrley

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: "bad" words
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! I ve also heard that fanny is used in the UK a little differently than we do in the US. We use it to mean butt, bottom, rear-end, etc....but they use it
messages.messageBody:
Hi!
I've also heard that "fanny" is used in the UK a little differently than we
do in the US. We use it to mean butt, bottom, rear-end, etc....but they use
it to mean...ummm..."woman parts." Is that right, Shyrley?
Amy
Amy Kagey
